# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_") |> replace("-" => "_")
end
```
The `replace` function in Julia replaces all occurrences of a substring with another substring. In this case, it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `lowercase` and `strip` functions make sure the column name is lowercased and stripped of leading or trailing whitespaces respectively.
